name: Rollin' Questions
description:
Movement: Player 1 (the green one) uses WASD to move and player 2 (the yellow one) uses the arrow keys to move.

This game originally had an analog component: cards, and those cards have questions on them, the questions are down below so if you have some index cards or something similar you can write them down yourself. 

How to play : You get 11 cards with the questions stated below (or wherever you wrote them down ) and shuffle them, then you put them somewhere both players can have easy access to them.  After you've done that begin the race, the one that wins the race asks the question at the end of the race.   The minimum amount of races are 3 and the maximum are 10, if both players answer the same amount of questions there will be a tiebreaker round.  The one that asks the most amount of questions wins.  

This is the prototype of a game that hopefully one day will be played with friends and also be used to help people in psychological therapy. 

The questions are:

1:Why is your favorite color your favorite color?

2:Why do you prefer x way to consume media?

3:Who do you look up to and why?

4:What is your favorite work of art? (includes: video games, movies, shows, books, dance, theater,etc...)

5:What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

6:If you were to meet someone living or dead who would it be , and why?

7:If you were to meet a fictional character who would it be, and why?

8:If you had the power to bring one person back from the dead, who would it be and why?

9:Would you want immortality at/from age 25 would you, and why?

10:if you could travel to any time period which one would it be and why?

11:Who do you look up to and why?
